Replace.Text: Scientific research pioneer: [NEWLINE] Diplomatic visibility +1, [ICON_influenceperturn] influence points +5, [ICON_favor] Diplomatic support +1. Each encounter with a city-state will have a +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route capacity. [NEWLINE][ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka offers an additional 10% technology. [NEWLINE]

Elves: [NEWLINE] Create a city to get an additional 2 territories. [ICON_capital]City housing within the 6th ring of the capital city +3, each [ICON_citizen] population provides +1 [ICON_gold] gold coins, +1 [ICON_production] productivity, and all output +5%, an additional +5% for each new player era you enter. Other cities output -50%. [NEWLINE] Director of Ecology Department: [NEWLINE] The beginning shows all strategic resources. Each cell in the country receives a random buff when it is improved for the first time. The city will receive a bonus based on the number of resources they own [NEWLINE]

Elves: [NEWLINE] Create a city to get an additional 2 territories. [ICON_capital]City housing within the 6th ring of the capital city +3, each [ICON_citizen] population provides +1 [ICON_gold] gold coins, +1 [ICON_production] productivity, and all output +5%, an additional +5% for each new player era you enter. Other cities output -50%. [NEWLINE] Director of Ecology Department: [NEWLINE] The beginning shows all strategic resources. When each cell in the country is improved for the first time, a random buff is obtained: [NEWLINE] A 40% probability of obtaining gold coins equivalent to the current technology value; a 40% probability of obtaining a cultural value equivalent to 50% of the current technology value; a 10% probability of obtaining an messenger; a 5% probability of obtaining a "crossroad" that does not require maintenance fees and iron; a 5% probability of obtaining a "crossroad" for free in the city center; a 5% probability of obtaining a pioneer without population. [NEWLINE]Cities will receive bonuses based on the number of resources they own (plus, luxury, strategy): [NEWLINE] Increase revenue and reduce expenditure (there are 0 types): Rhine headquarters and ecological park can release cultural bombs. [NEWLINE] Gradually moisturized (there are 1 types): On the basis of increasing revenue and reducing expenditure, the city can build an additional area. [NEWLINE]Ecological coupling (there are 2 types): On the basis of progressive emulsion, the city's loyalty will always be full. [NEWLINE]Shallow non-entropy adaptation (there are 3 types): Based on ecological coupling, the gain effect of "sprite" is automatically obtained without debuffing [NEWLINE]

Rhine Life Specialty College area, construction cost +20% and maintenance cost +100%. For each ICON_GreatScientist big scientist you get, the region produces an additional 1 [ICON_Science] technology; for each other civilization you get, the region produces an additional 1 [ICON_GreatScientist big scientist you get. [NEWLINE] The Rhine headquarters and its buildings will automatically receive all expert bonuses without the [ICON_citizen] population, and the expert bonus will be extra +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist points. Can perform 1-cell range city attacks. The city with Rhine headquarters makes the "crossroads" of production gained +25% [ICON_promotion] experience. [NEWLINE] Unlock the special project "Good night, Christen". After unlocking the alien mission, you can carry out a more powerful project "Good night, ChristenÂ²". [NEWLINE]

Muirses's special features are improved. It cannot be adjacent to another ecological park. [NEWLINE]Each adjacent strategic resource +1 [ICON_production] productivity, +1 [ICON_Science] technology; each adjacent luxury resource +1 [ICON_culture] culture, +1 [ICON_gold] gold coins; every adjacent bonus resource +1 [ICON_food] food, +1 [ICON_faith]faith[NEWLINE]

The Rhine life-specific wonder must be built on the plains of the adjacent Rhine headquarters. After completion, the ongoing technology and municipal affairs will be completed immediately. The country produces a maximum scientist point per round of [ICON_GreatScientist] +25%, and makes the country's productivity +25% when conducting space race projects. "Crossroad" is located or adjacent to "Planetary debris when it chooses to restore for one round, which can be fully restored during this period; the enemy forces in two grids around planetary debris -5[ICON_strength] force, -1[ICON_movement] movement speed [NEWLINE]

Rhine Life-style anti-cavalry unit, replaces gun stabs and shooting phalanxes, maintenance cost +100%, and requires iron production and maintenance. [NEWLINE] will not be restrained by melee units, -10 [ICON_strength] force when attacking but +15 [ICON_strength] force when defense. At the beginning and end of the round, it causes 5 [ICON_damaged] damage to enemies and buildings around you, and can also trigger this effect when you are attacked by melee. Not controlled by region[NEWLINE]

Muirses' characteristic investigation unit. Get a manifold for free at the beginning, but the maximum number of manifolds on the field cannot exceed 5. [NEWLINE]+1[ICON_movement]mobile force, with a little [ICON_charges] labor to improve resources, the upgrade tree is different. It will not be subject to any [ICON_movement] movement force debuffs and can enter the water cell initially. Not subject to regional control. [NEWLINE]
